title: Joe Root Dominates For England In The Ashes With Outstanding Century | 10 News
description: Travis Head is in superb touch on day two of the fifth Ashes Test at the SCG, leading the Aussie chase with Marnus Labuschagne. But it was Joe Root who dominated for the old enemy, with a brilliant innings of 160. title: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro To Face Firearms & Drugs Charges In American Court | 10 News
description: The deposed Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro will "shortly face" firearms and drugs charges in a Manhattan courtroom. The Trump administration still won't say how it intends to run the oil-rich country, having toppled its leader. The woman now notionally in charge, Maduro's deputy, has been issued a stark warning by the US President. title: Australian Families Now Eligible For Childcare Cost-of-Living Relief | 10 News
description: There's some cost-of-living relief for Australian families tonight with the federal government's childcare subsidies taking effect. The '3 Day Guarantee' is expected to save families hundreds of dollars a week, but some experts say the policy does nothing to address shortfalls in the childcare sector. title: Melbourne Family Terrorised By Armed Thugs During A Home Invasion | 10 News
description: An Altona North family has been left traumatised after three armed thugs smashed into their home, threatening a mother and her son with a gun. The group broke in through a bedroom window, where a teenage boy was sleeping. Three other children were also home at the time. title: Young Student Pilot Miraculously Escapes Plane Crash That Burst Into Flames | 10 News
description: Dramatic scenes have unfolded at Parafield Airport, where a young student pilot somehow managed to walk away from a dramatic crash landing. The 21-year-old behind the controls told 10 News he managed to jump from the aircraft as flames took hold moments after slamming into the ground. title: Trump Threatens Colombia, Cuba & Greenland After Maduro’s Capture | 10 News+
description: Less than 48 hours after his brazen capture of Venezuela’s President Nicolas Maduro, Donald Trump has made controversial remarks about other countries. The commander-in-chief predicted the fall of Cuba’s communist regime, called Colombia’s president a “sick man”, and doubled down on threats to annex Greenland from Denmark. Meanwhile, Venezuela’s deposed leader has spent his first night in a Brooklyn prison cell, as he prepares to face a US federal court over charges of narco-terrorism. title: Dawn Fraser Slams Albanese & Backs Calls For Bondi Royal Commission | 10 News+
description: Australian Olympic legend Dawn Fraser has slammed Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, claiming he has not done enough to address antisemitism. She delivered a speech at the site of the Bondi Beach terror attack, and has joined more than 60 other sporting greats to back calls for a royal commission into antisemitism. She spoke to 10 News+ about why she is speaking up and her support for the Jewish community. title: Elon Musk’s Grok AI Sparks Outrage Over Generating Sexualised Deepfakes | 10 News+
description: Elon Musk’s AI chatbot Grok is sparking outrage after it has been used to digitally remove the clothing of strangers and replace it with swimwear, in many cases without their consent or knowledge. It is illegal to create sexually explicit deepfakes without a person’s consent in some Australian states and territories, but not all. However, sharing the content is illegal no matter which state you live in. Chanel Contos, the CEO of Teach Us Consent, says the mismatch in legislation needs to be addressed with stronger national laws. title: Fallout Over Maduro's Capture, Musk's AI Deepfake Scandal, Dawn Fraser Slams Albanese | 10 News+
description: Less than 48 hours after his brazen capture of Venezuela’s President Nicolas Maduro, Donald Trump has made controversial remarks about other countries. The commander-in-chief predicted the fall of Cuba’s communist regime, called Colombia’s president a “sick man”, and doubled down on threats to annex Greenland from Denmark. Meanwhile, Venezuela’s deposed leader has spent his first night in a Brooklyn prison cell, as he prepares to face a US federal court over charges of narco-terrorism.  Elon Musk’s AI chatbot Grok is sparking outrage after it has been used to digitally remove the clothing of strangers and replace it with swimwear, in many cases without their consent or knowledge. It is illegal to create sexually explicit deepfakes without a person’s consent in some Australian states and territories, but not all. However, sharing the content is illegal no matter which state you live in. Chanel Contos, the CEO of Teach Us Consent, says the mismatch in legislation needs to be addressed with stronger national laws.  Australian Olympic legend Dawn Fraser has slammed Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, claiming he has not done enough to address antisemitism. She delivered a speech at the site of the Bondi Beach terror attack, and has joined more than 60 other sporting greats to back calls for a royal commission into antisemitism. She spoke to 10 News+ about why she is speaking up and her support for the Jewish community. title: Ten People Found Guilty Of Cyberbullying France’s First Lady Brigitte Macron | 10 News
description: Ten people have been found guilty of cyberbullying France’s first lady, Brigitte Macron, for spreading false claims online about her gender and sexuality in a Paris court.  The eight men and two women were found guilty of having posted "numerous malicious comments" falsely claiming that President Emmanuel Macron's wife was born a man and linking their 24-year age gap to “pedophilia”.  Gallerist and writer Bertrand Scholler said he would appeal his six-month suspended jail sentence.  The Macrons first met at the high school where he was a student and she was a teacher, before they got married in 2007. title: Delcy Rodríguez Steps In As Interim Venezuela President | 10 News
description: Delcy Rodríguez has been sworn in as the acting President of Venezuela, following the seizure of former president Nicolás Maduro by the US Military over the weekend.  During the ceremony, Rodríguez paid homage to Maduro and his wife (also captured by the US) Cilia Flores, calling them "heroes" and claiming that they were being "held hostage in the United States of America".  It comes as Maduro fronted a New York court on drug charges pleading not guilty, and claiming he was still President of Venezuela.  The Trump administration has signalled intent to work with Rodríguez, but has warned her against failing to abide by US demands. title: Venezuela’s Maduro Pleads Not Guilty To Narco-Terrorism Charges In New York Court | 10 News
description: Toppled Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro has pleaded not guilty in a New York federal court to charges including narco-terrorism and cocaine trafficking following his capture by US authorities.   The 63-year-old faces four criminal counts, with prosecutors alleging he oversaw a cocaine-smuggling network linked to international cartels and armed groups.   Speaking through a translator, Maduro told the court, “I am innocent. I am not guilty. I am a decent man,” before being cut off by the judge.   Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, were seized in a US military operation in Caracas and flown under heavy guard to Manhattan.   Flores also entered a not-guilty plea, with her lawyer saying she was injured during the arrest and needs medical care.   The case has been adjourned until March 17 as supporters and opponents of the US action gathered outside the courthouse. title: Israel Launches Airstrikes On Southern Lebanon | 10 News
description: Israel has launched an attack on Lebanon, with airstrikes hitting the southern town of Aanan on Monday, January 5. According to an Israeli military spokesperson, the strikes were targeting Hezbollah and Hamas military infrastructure in Hammara and Ain el-Tineh in eastern Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley, and Kfar Hatta and Aanan in the south. The strikes came after evacuation orders were issued for four villages in the country’s east and south. The attacks are seen as a breach of the US‑brokered ceasefire agreed in late 2024, which halted more than a year of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah. Since then, both sides have accused each other of violating the ceasefire.
